channel.title: BUscience
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUscience, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The true global impact of species-loss caused by humans is far greater than expected
item.description: The extinction of hundreds of bird species caused by humans over the last 130,000 years has led to substantial reductions in avian functional diversit...

item.title: Wastewater bacteria can breakdown plastic for food
item.description: Comamonadacae is a family of bacteria often found growing on plastics in water. A new study finds a bacterium in this family can break down the plasti...

item.title: Turning brain cells on using the power of light
item.description: Researchers have developed a noninvasive way of using bioluminescent optogenetics to activate parts of the brain.

item.title: Spanish cave's submerged land bridge reveals that humans colonized the western Mediterranean earlier than thought

item.title: Green subsidies may have hidden costs, experts warn
item.description: Government subsidies for business practices and processes should be approached with caution, even when they seem to be environmentally friendly, write...

item.title: Not just a bunch of hot air: Plant responses to higher temperatures change depending on how hot it gets

item.title: Ant agriculture began 66 million years ago in the aftermath of the asteroid that doomed the dinosaurs
